content:
@Rishi Gupta want a feedback
as we discussed previously on this at here, i have made the table

available column --> those keywords which are already available
new column --> contain that keywords which to be added for corresponding emoji

example type thumbs up or like it gives us --> :+1:

available new (to add) emoji
thumbs up like :+1:
sick ill :sick:
sick fever :sick:
sunglasses awesome :sunglasses:
ok nice :ok:
palm_tree vacation, holiday :palm_tree:
clap great :clap:
sunglasses cool :sunglasses:
handshake agree :handshake:
shrug ignore
tada hooray :tada:
done right
hurt accident :hurt:

awesome, thanks!

  • The first 4 look good
  • I'd be interested in more opinions on "nice"
  • vacation sounds good. holiday conflicts with holiday tree, so I think we'll want to be thoughtful about that.
  • Would like more opinions on "great"
  • cool conflicts with our existing cool emoji. It's totally possible we should just get rid of that emoji though?
  • Will have to think about agree, ignore, hooray, right, and accident, though agreed that those are all reasonable ones to support.

Do you want to open a PR for the ones that are decided?
I'm a little skeptical of nice+great.

I also don‚Äôt understand how sunglasses becomes awesome. I can think of very few contexts where I would replace the word awesome with sunglasses whereas something like üëåüèΩ or üíØ makes more sense to me.
This is great by the way ( I‚Äôve been wanting these synonyms for a long time üëçüèΩ )

@Rishi Gupta

Do you want to open a PR for the ones that are decided

yes

vacation sounds good. holiday conflicts with holiday tree, so I think we'll want to be thoughtful about that.

So we only take vacation and remove holiday

Would like more opinions on "great"

do you want to change emoji for great or more suggestion for clap?

cool conflicts with our existing cool emoji. It's totally possible we should just get rid of that emoji though?

agree to remove

@Armaan Ahluwalia

I also don‚Äôt understand how sunglasses becomes awesome.

I thought it would be suitable for :sunglasses: emoji

whereas something like :ok:üèΩ or üíØ makes more sense to me

i agree with you, we can show :ok:üèΩ or üíØ for awesome
@Rishi Gupta opened a PR
Thanks! Btw, https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/subsystems/emoji.html is a good read, if you haven't alerady.

For cool, let's do:

  • The current :cool: can become :squared_cool:
  • We can add :cool: to :sunglasses:

@Rhythm Sharma do you want to open a PR for that?
@Rishi Gupta Looks Good To Me, but my old PR was merged and closed now i am waiting for thier reply here to reopen it
you can just push to that PR, and reopen it

@Rishi Gupta PR opened

  • The current :cool: can become :squared_cool:
  • We can add :cool: to :sunglasses:

done, committed above suggestions

what are your thoughts on holiday/vacation?
i think we only take vacation and remove holiday for this --> :holiday_tree: emoji,
and for shrug we can add whatever type of word

@Rishi Gupta
what are your thoughts on holiday/vacation?
i think we only take vacation and remove holiday for this --> :holiday_tree: emoji,
and for shrug we can add whatever type of word
@Rishi Gupta if you like, can i add documentation on how to add aliases

I think adding vacation for :palm_tree: makes sense.

For documentation: there's a script that generates an html table view of all the current names, and how they look across the three emoji sets. Do you know if the current documentation covers that?
docs/subsystems/emoji.md is the main emoji docs.
So @Rhythm Sharma can check there.

@Tim Abbott i checked the documentation (docs/subsystems/emoji.md)

For documentation: there's a script that generates an html table view of all the current names, and how they look across the three emoji sets.

@Rishi Guptaare you talking about tooling section ?

yeah, though that looks out of date (e.g. not sure we use emoji_setup_utils.py anymore). This might be too hard of a task, but the next documentation task is probably to document export_emoji_names_to_csv, generate_emoji_names_table, and import_emoji_names_from_csv
(I think those files have comments at the top, but I guess those comments never made into readthedocs)
@Harshit Bansal would you be up for helping with updating the emoji docs page?
@Tim Abbott @Rishi Gupta actually i didn't get which things to update for emoji docs can someone give me a rough plan
I think this is probably something either Harshit or I should take care of
Agreed, writing docs on a system is best done by folks who know it well.

Agreed, writing docs on a system is best done by folks who know it well.

got it

• Will have to think about agree, ignore, hooray, right, and accident, though agreed that those are all reasonable ones to support.
available new (to add) emoji
handshake agree :handshake:
shrug ignore
tada hooray :tada:
done right
hurt accident :hurt:

@Rishi Gupta what are your thoughts on this 5 additions ?

The diligence that would be needed for each word is

  • Use the tools mentioned above to see what the emoji look like in each of the three sets, for each of the plausible emoji that could be assigned to the word
  • Check what other emoji appear in the typeahead for the word (most of these are fine; right might be complicated here)

You can paste the output of the first step here.
That being said, there are many more straightforward issues I would work on first, if you're working towards a gsoc packet.

Use the tools mentioned above to see what the emoji look like in each of the three sets, for each of the plausible emoji that could be assigned to the word

@Rishi Gupta would you tell me where can i find it
You can trying something like git ls-files | grep
@Rishi Gupta you can review PR, all your suggestion are added
@Rishi Gupta After all, it's done. Thanks for your guidance, this is what I love about this community. Please Review Emoji:aliases again.
@Rishi Gupta is it the dot in the end PR

Rishi Gupta is it the dot in the end PR

Yes. It should be something like:
emoji: Include more useful aliases for emojis.
Running ./tools/lint --frontend on your Dev env would be useful in these cases. It helps you figure out and fix issues locally.
thanks for you guidance @Vinit Singh actually I had exams that's why I am responding late. I have changed commit message ,please review PR
@Rishi Gupta please review this again add emoji PR
(delete)
(delete)

@Rishi Gupta two things done in Emoji: Add useful aliases PR
1 add aliases
2 bump provision number
please review this pR(https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/12039)
it still conflicts, i think you have to do this (access permission issue)

@Rhythm Sharma I left a comment to solve the conflicts. Note, that you don't need write access to solve the conflicts in your PR. You can solve conflicts locally, commit changes and then force push the changes to PR.

@Yashashvi Dave i tried but it didn't work out, you can see conflict, those pointing arrows are added automatically those are conflicts hence i had to remove them manually and after removing them a commit was added and that commit is not shown in my commit history, so i can't squash Screenshot-from-2019-04-03-18-50-08.png
@Rhythm Sharma Rebase your PR according to this guideline. To solve conflicts follow this guideline step by step. This should solve your issue.
@Yashashvi Dave it's done you can review, though i have to open new PR
Great! As a side note, you can always update your existing PR by forcefully pushing your changes.
@Yashashvi Dave if everything is alright then please merge that PR
@Rhythm Sharma Someone from core member will review and merge your PR, till then you can work on another issue.
agree, but if someone update provision number in his/her PR then it will again conflict
@Rhythm Sharma Your commit message still doesn't follow the guidelines, please read the docs and edit it.
@Nikhil Vats tell me the right commit message, I know docs :smile:
